intro: Borabora cyperoidea, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyperus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the sedge family (Cyperaceae) and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with slender, erect stems. The plant typically grows in wet, coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Borabora cyperoidea plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various native insects and birds.
